result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Waller Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L. Waller Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert L. Waller Jr. was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

To Court from R.L.W. Jr

ADDRESS INFO for Robert L. Waller Jr.
Current: PO Box 3310, c/o Oshkosh Correctional Inst.  # 430572, Oshkosh, WI 54903 United States  (Effective: 01-30-2017)
Prior: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge County Correctional, Waupun, WI 53963 United States
Telephone conference on February 16, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Robert L. Waller in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Robert L. Waller in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Zamzow agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court and asks that the sentence be concurrent.  Atty Zamzow asks the court to grant work release and that the sentence be able to be served while he is in prison.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
May serve the 30 days in the Wisconsin State Prison System.

with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Defendant Robert L. Waller in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Robert L. Waller in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant states that he is in Dodge Correctional.  Atty Zamzow states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow enters a Not Guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause to continue on the charges.

  BY THE COURT:   Not Guilty plea entered.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return
  Return date scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
